articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States abstained on Monday in a United Nations vote on a resolution it drafted to mark the third anniversary of Russia's invasion of Ukraine after the General Assembly agreed to add language supportive of Kyiv to Washington's text.
articles.title: Europeans win in UN clash with US over rival Ukraine resolutions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Monday that Russia was not opposed to Europe's involvement in Russia-U.S. peace talks aimed at settling the conflict in Ukraine, but noted that Brussels had long rejected any dialogue with Moscow.
articles.title: Putin says Russia open to Europe's involvement in peace talks on Ukraine

articles.author: Riham Alkousaa
articles.description: Omar Alkadamani, a Syrian-born, naturalised German citizen, used to support Germany's centre-left Social Democrats. Unsettled by its increasingly tough stance on migration, however, he cast his vote on Sunday for the far-left Left Party.
articles.title: Resurgence of Germany’s Left exposes fragmented, polarised electorate

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: The estimated cost to rebuild Ukraine's economy after Russia's invasion has risen to $524 billion, nearly three times its expected 2024 economic output, the World Bank, United Nations, European Commission and the Ukrainian government found.
articles.title: Ukraine needs $524 billion to recover, rebuild after three years of war, World Bank says

articles.author: Andy Sullivan, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: U.S. government workers who have been buffeted by President Donald Trump's chaotic return to power face more uncertainty on Monday, when many of them will be required to justify their jobs to Elon Musk, the chainsaw-wielding billionaire tasked with slashing the federal budget.
articles.title: Some US government workers told to justify their jobs to Musk, others told to ignore him

articles.author: Ramadan Abed
articles.description: Awaiting the release of her son after more than three decades in jail, 75-year-old Najat El Agha had searched the ruined streets of Gaza for some modest supplies to welcome him back.
articles.title: Gaza mother's hopes for return of long-jailed son dashed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Germany's outgoing parliament could still greenlight a new special fund to boost defence spending but reforming strict limits on state borrowing will be deferred to the new one, a senior ally of election winner Friedrich Merz said on Tuesday.
articles.title: German defence boost but no debt brake reform in outgoing parliament, Merz ally says

articles.author: Timour Azhari
articles.description: Syria's interim president said on Tuesday his country had a "historic opportunity" to rebuild, addressing a national dialogue summit billed by Syria's Islamist rulers as a key milestone after decades of Assad-family rule.
articles.title: National dialogue a 'historic opportunity' for Syria, interim president says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The mother of jailed Egyptian-British dissident Alaa Abd el-Fattah was taken to hospital on Monday night as she neared the 150th day of a hunger strike in protest against her son's imprisonment in Egypt.
articles.title: Jailed Egyptian-British dissident's hunger-striking mother hospitalised

articles.author: Karen Freifeld, Doina Chiacu
articles.description: Former Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel and other former U.S. national security officials on Tuesday warned that China was outpacing the U.S. in critical technology fields and urged Congress to increase funding for federal scientific research.
articles.title: Former US security officials say funding for federal science research critical to race with China
